column4: Could someone help? I have recently been given a printer ( Lexmark 2200 series ) and I can get it to work on my Ubuntu 10.10. I have tryed the printer manager and it failed to find anything.
Anyone?
Ubuntu version you're using now?
Ubuntu 10.10.
and I can get it to work on my Ubuntu 10.10 <------------ Get the printer to work, what more do you want to do now? Is it an ALL-IN-ONE type?
It is a printer as well as a scanner. And I have tried every way I know to get the drivers and I have failed, so do you have any other suggestions?
It is a printer as well as a scanner. And I have tried every way I know to get the drivers and I have failed, so do you have any other suggestions?
It is a printer as well as a scanner. And I have tried every way I know to get the drivers and I have failed, so do you have any other suggestions?
Visit here: http://support.lexmark.com/index?page=productSelection&userlocale=EN_US&locale=EN

Please, don't feel ignored and repeat your question quickly; if nobody knows your answer, nobody will answer you. While you wait, try searching https://help.ubuntu.com or http://ubuntuforums.org or http://askubuntu.com/
I couldn't find your model there. It might had been an x2500, the closet I found :S
Ok sorry about pestering you. The model is X2250
Up to be a ubuntu lab rat? :P          Give this a try: http://community.linuxmint.com/tutorial/view/220   "How to make, unsupported Lexmark X2500 (''2500series'') Work".
Good luck with the 7 steps.
Ha ha, your very funny :-P By the way it's not X2500 it's X2250 :-))
Oops.
I'm sure you could not be bothered- Lol :D
Oops! I mean Oops!!! :D
Hope I haven't offended you, thanks for the help. If it does not work I will be back here to pester you! :D
Lol. BTW, can you run two of these commands in terminal?: dmesg            and           lsusb            and pastebin back results?
OK here your pastes as you requested.....  http://paste.ubuntu.com/710177/                        http://paste.ubuntu.com/710176/
